I am pleased the House passed a continuing resolution yesterday which will ensure our government remains open & key programs remain authorized. If passed by the Senate we will have more time to negotiate funding in the coming fiscal year & avoid another costly government shutdown

Every person should be able to afford their medication, their lives depend on it – it is unacceptable that companies continue to raise drug costs on hard working Americans and its past time Congress put a stop to it. #LowerDrugCosts
This week House Democrats introduced H.R. 3, the Lower Drug Costs Now Act, which will begin the process of passing legislation to lower prescription drug costs for all Americans. #LowerDrugCosts

Yesterday @OversightDems held a hearing on HR51 the Washington D.C. Admission Act which would make D.C. the 51st state. There are over 700,000 American citizens which includes 30,000 Veterans that reside in Washington, D.C. & they deserve equal representation in their government.
The #FAIRAct is imperative to help restore Americans’ rights to seek justice and accountability against corporate wrongdoers in court.

Today the House passed H.R. 1423, the Forced Arbitration Injustice Repeal Act #FAIRAct which would block corporations from imposing forced arbitration as a pre-condition to their employees or consumers.

We must continue to provide health care and support for the thousands of 9/11 survivors and first responders who still suffer from lingering lung damage and other health challenges because of their involvement in rescue operations that day. #NeverForget

If you or someone you know is in crisis, you can call 1-800-273-8255 or text TALK to 741-741.  For all Veterans in need of assistance you can call 1-800-273-8255 and press 1 or text 838-255. #SuicidePrevention

Today on World #SuicidePrevention Day we must reaffirm as a country that we are committed to addressing the crisis of suicide by helping those struggling with severe depression and in need of assistance.
